text:
We've contributed a (very clean) JNA-based implementation of a Negotiate authenticator that supports both Kerberos and NTLM (including POST). I think it should ship with Tomcat along with the other authenticators. 

It's windows-only, I am not sure what the philosophy is around that kind of stuff.

Waffle is @ http://waffle.codeplex.com.

The authenticator code can be seen here: http://waffle.codeplex.com/SourceControl/changeset/view/52689#
creator: dblock@dblock.org

text:
@Tim: check out source code from https://waffle.svn.codeplex.com/svn/trunk/Source/JNAWindowsAuthProvider. waffle.apache.NegotiateAuthenticator is a pure Tomcat authenticator, for example (there're also servlet filters, etc.)

Note that Waffle and code suggested in 48685 follow a very different route - Waffle uses JNA and Windows SSPI (works only on Windows) while 48685 is a kerberos-only implementation with Geronimo.
creator: dblock@dblock.org
markt@apache.org
text:
Waffle is a nice solution but at just under 2MB is on the large size to ship as part of the default Tomcat distribution. The license is EPL so that is not an issue (in binary form) - it is just the size.

What I am doing is adding a Windows authentication How-to to the Tomcat docs where Waffle will certainly get a prominent mention. Edits to that page (within reason) are welcome. The latest version of the page is available from the ASF ci builds: http://ci.apache.org/projects/tomcat/tomcat7/docs/windows-auth-howto.html
